title: I.Sicily inscription 004357
support: Part of a marble funerary altar, with moulding across the top. The upper part is somewhat damaged / worn; the surviving stone has been cut/sawn to left and right, and it is unclear if the base is original or not (the stone is mounted in a plaster block for display).

layout.p: Three lines of large relatively thin letters are partially preserved.

handNote.lettering: Tall, narrow letters, v-cut, with clear terminations/serifs at stroke ends. E is narrow with strokes of equal length; M has full-length strokes, first and last near vertical.

provenanceFound._: Original discovery is not recorded, but among Syracusan material in the initial inventory of the museum, compiled in 1885.

provenanceObserved._: Photographed in magazzino C of the museum, but not formally recorded, in 2014/15

facsimile.desc: Photo J. Prag (2014), Aut. Assessorato Beni Culturali Regione Siciliana n.10681 del 06/05/2014
